title: Positive Thinking with a Paralympic Hero
act_int: Wish you had more motivation?Fear of failure holding you back?Want to thrive under pressure?This engaging Online Experience will help you to learn about the positive mindset that has enabled me to have a successful career in professional sport spanning over four decades.Your most powerful muscle is in your head. In this interactive session, you will discover how to build a positive mindset that will change your way of thinking to see adversity not as a barrier, but as an opportunity to improve and learn.- Practice light meditation to clear your mind.- Enjoy listening to my stories of determination and grit in the face of adversity.- Discover my secrets to performing under pressure.- Start building unstoppable motivation & resilience.- Learn how to set goals and start to achieve them with my 4-step guide. You'll have the opportunity to ask questions, take part in activities, see my Paralympic medals, and watch footage of me competing!This is truly unique, and all you have to bring is an open mind.*Can't see a date/time that works for you? Please contact me*Perfect for team-building and offsites - Book a private experience for your team. Message me to discuss further*A great experience for private groups looking to gather virtually! Whether you're connecting with family, friends, or co-workers*Duration can be adaptedTwitter: @hailfabioIG: hailfabio1
about_author: I'm a 6-time British Paralympic athlete. I competed at Atlanta 1996, Sydney 2000, Athens 2004, Beijing 2008, London 2012, and Rio 2016. I've won 6 Paralympic medals, including 3 Gold medals in the sport of athletics.I was born with cerebral palsy, and while it challenges me every day of my life, I was instilled with a tremendously positive attitude by my parents, as well as many great coaches and mentors along the way. They taught me how to harness the energy of positive thinking to overcome and embrace adversity.Throughout my years as a professional athlete, I've come to realise that life is full of adversity, struggle, and challenge, but it's in these moments when we feel most alive and can have our greatest achievements. I've helped many people overcome adversity with positive thinking and now I want to inspire even more people.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: No hurdle is impossible to overcome
act_int: Have you ever wondered what makes the athlete's mindset such a powerful tool in achieving success and how we can deliver performance when it matters? Here’s the good news: I will share how anyone can achieve their dreams with the right vision and mindset. During this event, I show videos of the key moments in my life and the races that defined me as an athlete. I start by sharing my unique and motivational journey—from being pulled from the wreckage of a car to standing on the podium in Athens 2004, and beyond. Then I will help you to create your path to success using my “Five Key Elements to Success.” I believe you need to own your journey to truly engage with it.
about_author: I am a Paralympic gold medal winner and former 800 meter World Record holder. During my 12-year athletic career, I was honored to represent Great Britain at three Paralympic Games, three World Championships, and much more. I am now a published author, business owner, TV presenter, event host, executive coach, and global speaker. All of this has been achieved not as a result of a life-changing injury, but rather a change in mindset.During my session it is the powerful shift in mindset that I will not only share with you, but most importantly equip you with tools and techniques to enable you to be successful in your career or personal goals.  Over the past 20yrs I have been sharing my powerful 5 key elements to success model with corporate business around the world.  Through air BnB you too now have access.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2021

title: Power of adaptability with Vanessa Low
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and German
act_int: Adaptability intelligence (AQ) is the ability to adapt to anything life throws at you and embrace change with optimism and a problem-solving mentality. Together well will discover strategies that will help you live a happier and more successful life through accessing this increasingly important skill.During this one hour session I would love to take you with me on my journey from loosing my legs at the age of 15 to becoming a Paralympic gold medallist long jumper. I will share insights in how I was challenged by the loss of mobility, independence and most of all the loss of believe in myself and my dreams through which I have learnt to understand that adversity always comes with a second face: The face of a great chance, the chance to adapt , to challenge our belief system and the chance to imagine everything that can be.
about_author: When I lost both of my legs in a tragic train accident at the age of 15, I was told I would never be able to walk again.  I spend 2 weeks in a coma, 6 moths in hospital and underwent 9 surgeries, yet the toughest part of my journey was believing in myself and my abilities in a world that taught me the opposite. However, my story it not driven by adversity, my story really is about taking action against the odds, a story written by choices and courage.Determined to reach beyond perceived present limitations, I made the decision to take charge over my life and take a chance achieving the unimaginable. I went on to become a Paralympic gold medalist and world record holder in the long jump.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2013

title: Win the Morning with Liz Gleadle
act_int: Do you feel slow, half awake, or unfocused in the morning? Or maybe you grab your phone upon waking, get lost in it, and then end up scrambling to get ready?So did I.I STRUGGLED with being alert, focused and feeling good physically. Upon waking, I would check my phone, then rush to make coffee and get to practice. These practices were… unproductive - to say the least.In order to qualify for the Games, I needed to break my own National Record by 3 meters / 10 feet.  If I wanted a shot at making the team, mastering my mornings was a non-negotiable.Over the last decade, I have studied, tested, refined my morning routine to produce an optimized mental and physiological state - in 15-20 minutes. I call it my "minimum effective dose" routine.Win the Morning involves:    1. Drinking water, mixed with Salt &  lime   2. Reclaiming Your Blank Slate -  choosing your first thoughts   3. Meditating - 1 minute   4. Movement - 90 seconds   5. Cold Shower - 1 minuteIn this online experience, we walk through the routine  together and talk about the science behind it. I'll also share the incredible story of how I made my first Olympics.At the end of the event, I give out a “cheat sheet” with the how-to’s, science, and additional resources.This experience is tailored for team-building! Upon request, it can be shortened to a 50 minute webinar style event.
about_author: I have the most incredible (and strange) job: I throw the javelin for a living. I’ve represented Canada at the 2012, 2016 & 2020NE Olympics and competed as a professional athlete for ten years. My favorite part of this journey has been the opportunity to continuously learn and apply new information, habits, and activities that unlock our incredible human potential.I want to share my most curated and effective habit: a morning routine that sets you up to win the day. I’ve hosted a variety of athletes, go-getters, and company groups online through my routine; I look forward to taking you through it as well!(Copyright Getty Images)
author_time: Olympian · Representing Canada · Host on Airbnb since 2016

title: Warm up to win with Kurt Cuoto
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and Portuguese
act_int: First things first, we'll get to know one another, then I’ll show and tell you what it’s like to be in lockdown as an Olympian. I’ll share my story and journey with you. Next, we'll do a little exercise where you’ll mirror what I do to get ready before race day. Once we are finished with the exercise, we'll have a Q&A where you may ask as many questions as you like.
about_author: I’m from Mozambique, although I call Pretoria, South Africa, my home. I’ve been competing in athletic hurdling for some time now, around 17 years. I am a four-time Olympian (2004-2016) and I'm bidding for my fifth Olympics—let’s call it Tokyo 2020-1. Come and hear about my passion for the sport of hurdling, the highs and lows, and the sacrifices I made to be able to live the Olympic dream.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Mozambique · Host on Airbnb since 2016

title: 'Go for Gold' The Olympic Mindset Tips & Games
act_int: This is a great team building experience with games, stories, and mindset tips to set big goals, overcome obstacles, and achieve success directly from your host - 2x Olympian in beach volleyball, Lina Taylor!Succeeding against the odds is the theme of this experience! With exercises and games, you will discover actionable tips for success. You'll hear some very personal stories, showing you not only that Olympians have challenges like most of us but more importantly, I'll share with you the steps I take to overcome challenges and achieve big goals. I've recently shared this experience with companies like Google, Pfizer, Twitter, Intel, Shopify, and many more. Here's what one recent participant had to say:“Probably the best presentation of the year. An amazing personal story, truly inspirational, and real actions we can use to improve our own lives.”GREAT FOR GROUPS, TEAM BUILDING, FAMILIES, FRIENDS. CONTACT ME to request your special day and time, if it's not listed.
about_author: I'm a two-time Olympian in beach volleyball, entrepreneur, mentor to elite athletes, and a mother of three. All the success I've had in my life didn't come easy. Through engaging stories, games, and exercises, I share practical takeaways that anyone can apply to turn obstacles into opportunities, deal with change successfully, and achieve big goals. Growing up in communist Bulgaria, I had big dreams but even bigger challenges. Yet, I found a way to higher education in America. Getting cut from my team, living in poverty, going through bankruptcy, divorce, and losing a job - I found a way to persevere through adversity and achieve my dreams of playing in the Olympics, creating a family, and building a successful business. Join me for an inspiring and impactful experience, filled with games, engaging stories, and practical mindset tips!
author_time: Olympian · Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2018

title: A Champion Mindset with Michelle Carter
act_int: In this Experience you’ll need a pen and paper because you’ll want to take notes—you won’t want to miss a thing. First, we’ll start by getting to know one another. Next, I’ll share my five “champion's mindset” principles and walk you through how to apply these principles to different areas of your life. To end the Experience, we’ll each share the principle that’ll make the biggest impact. Share? Yes, share. Your words have power. When you speak, things happen—and champions make things happen. Are you ready?This Experience is great for team-building. Looking to reconnect with your colleagues and teammates while working from home? Send me a message!Other things to noteRemember to find a nice quiet space where you can focus and have a good internet connection.
about_author: With over 20 years of experience as an elite athlete and becoming the first American to win an Olympic gold medal in Women's Shot Put—I throw the heavy metal ball in Track and Field—I have developed a way to create a champion's mindset. A champion's mindset is about digging deeper when it matters the most. It's about becoming the best version of yourself when the odds are stacked against you. Some people think a champion's mindset is too hard to grasp. But I’ve had the pleasure to speak to a variety of audiences ranging from students to corporate executives all over the United States, and have made a champion's mindset relatable and attainable. Now, I'm bringing a champion's mindset to you through this online Experience.Copyright Getty Images
author_time: Olympian · Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Building Mental Resilience with Olympian Lina Taylor
act_int: Give your team the best tools to build resilience, overcome challenges, and get to know each other in a new way, uniting around your common goal. Your host, two-time Olympian Lina Taylor will create a bonding atmosphere by sharing personal stories of overcoming challenges and succeeding against the odds. Your team will have a chance to learn, share, and develop a deeper appreciation for one another.Combining the high performance principles of an elite athlete with corporate business experience and the latest research in neuroscience, Lina will share the 5 steps to building mental resilience. Then, through a short series of facilitated questions, the group will create a team manifesto — a highly motivating proclamation that unites your efforts in the pursuit of a common goal, focusing on the outcomes you want to create. Great for corporate teams and private groups!*More times available upon request - if your desired date and time is not listed, please send me a message.
about_author: I'm a two-time Olympian in beach volleyball, entrepreneur, mentor to elite athletes, and a mother of three. All the success I've had in my life didn't come easy. Through engaging stories, games, and exercises, I share practical takeaways that anyone can apply to turn obstacles into opportunities, deal with change successfully, and achieve big goals. My background is rooted in overcoming adversity: I grew up in communist Bulgaria, paved a path to higher education in America, qualified for the Olympics against all odds, and became a successful entrepreneur. This allows me to see things from diverse perspectives and deliver an effective presentation, combined with engaging and thoughtful exercises for your group. I invite you and your team to experience the transformational power of the 5 Steps to Building Mental Resilience.
author_time: Olympian · Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2018

title: Goal setting with a Gold Medalist
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and French
act_int: Hello, I look forward to sharing some fun online Experiences that will support your next objectives. Before the Experiences, I am available to connect with you or the organizer of the event to learn more on your objectives for the session to optimize each Experiences. I will share tools and tips on accomplishing your goals. I’ll teach techniques on building a set of short-, mid-, and long-term objectives. Please do not hesitate to ask specific questions as I’m here to make this Experience as engaging as possible. I’m available to share specific on becoming more effective and productive at work and finding a balance in your day to day life. I can work individually or within groups to maximize your confident as you are aiming to accomplish your next goal. I look forward to meet you & have fun!
about_author: Je suis Ben. Je suis né avec un handicap sur ma jambe droite connu sous le nom de pied bot. J'ai commencé à nager à l'âge de 8 ans et j'ai eu le grand privilège de participer en tant que nageur à 5 Jeux paralympiques de Sydney 2000, Athènes 2004, Pékin 2008, Londres 2012 et Rio 2016 ramenant 20 médailles paralympiques dont 9 d'or.Je suis ici pour partager avec vous mon parcours et parler de la façon dont nous devons nous adapter face à l'adversité. Se concentrer sur vos objectifs sera l'un de nos sujets lors de ces expériences amusantes en ligne.En tant qu'athlète, nous avons appris à être résilients. Nous traversons des échecs et, par conséquent, nous avons appris à identifier ce qui fonctionne. Je crois que la capacité de résilience est l'une des compétences les plus puissantes à avoir pour atteindre un objectif.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Canada · Host on Airbnb since 2015

title: Cultivating Optimism with Deena Kastor
act_int: From my home in Mammoth Lakes, California, I'll host you, friends, family, your team, or bookclub in this unique storytelling hour about the power of positivity. I will discuss my Olympic experiences, and share powerful strategies so that you can reach your potential. You don't have to be an athlete to benefit from positive thinking. Cultivating a more optimistic perspective works for you no matter your profession or passion. Optimism can take you to unimaginable heights. In our hour together, I'll share how it lifted me, with anecdotal stories, exercises, and (fun) homework! This experience is great for families or team-building. Book a private experience for your group. Want a date and time not listed? Send me a message and I'll accommodate if I can. Together, we can spread the good.  Let's connect, and allow me to lift you to a personal best, to your potential, and ultimately to your happiness.
about_author: For more than 20 years as a professional athlete, I’ve worked as much on my mental fitness as I have my physical fitness. Doing so allowed me the honor of holding every American record in running distances between 5K and the marathon, and representing the United States on 19 national teams. I'm an Olympic medalist, the American record holder in the marathon, and winner of the London and Chicago marathons. A couple of years ago, I decided to write about the mental evolution of my career in the book, Let Your Mind Run: A Memoir of Thinking My Way To Victory. It became a New York Times Bestseller. Since its release, I continue to run and race, but find great joy in motivational speaking and connecting with others who want to explore the fitness of their greatest asset—their mind.©Getty images
author_time: Olympian · Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2016

title: Yoga with Olympic Champion Kat Copeland
act_int: We'll ease ourselves in with a cup of tea and some introductions. I'll share my experience of the Olympic Games, including some personal behind-the-scenes photos, and talk about what life is like as a full-time elite athlete. We'll then flow through a creative hatha yoga class suitable for any level of yogi, whether you're a complete novice or a regular on the mat. My goal will be to find something that feels good for you and to help you finish feeling better than when you started. At the end, I'll answer any questions you might have, from training and fitness to what it's like to sit on the starting line of an Olympic final or live in the Olympic Village. I’m trained and fully qualified to teach hatha, vinyasa, yin, and restorative yoga, so if you're booking a private class, the style of yoga can be very much dictated by you, your needs, and what you're feeling that day.This experience is great for team-building. Book a private experience for your group. Is your group larger than my listed max group size for private groups or you'd like a different time slot? Send me a message.Other things to noteIf you have any injuries or concerns, please drop me a message before class so I can adapt the experience to support you best.
about_author: I'm Kate, an Olympic champion, two-time Olympian at the London and Rio Games, and a fully qualified yoga teacher. In addition to my Olympic achievements, I’m also a multiple World and European medalist, and I’ve broken several world record times. Since retiring from rowing one year ago, I've been sharing my passion for sports through coaching and mentoring younger athletes. I’ve also worked with numerous businesses and universities, providing talks and insight on performance psychology and the lessons I've learned. 12 years ago I started practicing yoga- I loved having some time to chill out amid my full-time rowing training. I now teach several group classes a week and love that I get to meet people and help students to move their bodies and find something that feels good for them.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2012

title: High performance with Scott Reardon
act_int: In these sessions I’ll pass on some of the knowledge and habits I’ve gained over a 12-year career in track and field.As an athlete, I’ve been able to achieve some amazing feats, including four consecutive championship golds, breaking all the records in my class over 100 meters.Performing at a high level over a prolonged period can be difficult. This doesn’t come easy and won’t happen overnight, but I’ll teach you a few simple, repeatable tasks that you can implement regularly to improve your own performance.The sessions are aimed at everyone from parents who want to live a better quality of life to corporations who what to improve the performance of their workforce.
about_author: I’ve been an elite athlete for over 12 years and have reached the pinnacle of my sport, winning medals and breaking records. I always wanted to represent Australia, but my leg was amputated when I was 12. It may seem like the end of the world, but for me it was the greatest opportunity. I became the world champion in water-skiing before changing sports and winning golds in track and field.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2015

title: The art of recovery with Liz Gleadle
act_int: Do you work all day, and then feel so exhausted that the only thing you want to do is watch Netflix? Do you implement intense work/health/life-overhauls, but then feel overwhelmed and abandon your plan?In this online experience, Liz teaches and inspires participants how to strategically integrate rest for better performance and wellbeing.Armed with a B.Sc. in Kinesiology, a passion for learning all things high performance, and a 17 years of experience throwing javelin for Team Canada, Liz loves helping others to function at their highest capacity!Together you'll go through a range of pre-emtive and reactive rest and recovery strategies including:- How to feel GOOD while taking a break (and not secretly berating yourself for being "lazy")- How to get a more effective night's sleep (and how to get out of that awful habit of watching tv to fall asleep)- Breakfast dos and don'ts- How to prevent and clear mid-day brain fogGuests should have a pen and paper, or their prefered note taking device. The "Art of Recovery Checklist" will given out after the experience.This hour-long online experience is great for team building and large groups, and a great follow up event to Win The Morning!
about_author: I have the most incredible (and strange) job: I throw the javelin for a living. I’ve represented Canada at the 2012, 2016 & 2020NE Olympics and competed as a professional athlete for ten years.My favorite part of this journey has been the opportunity to continuously learn and apply new information, habits, and activities that unlock our incredible human potential.Earlier in my career, my mantra was " I will NEVER be outworked!". Although this was useful for a while, eventually it lead to mistakes, injuries, burnout, and loss of love for my sport.Through several humbling and revelatory experiences, I learned that rest was integral to becoming my best, and having a longer career in sport."All gains are made in recovery" and "Work smarter instead of harder" are now two of my guiding principles.
author_time: Olympian · Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2016

title: Positivity with Scott and Vanessa
act_int: We all go through tough times; facing challenges and dealing with change is part of life. In this session, we’ll explore how, when things don’t go our way, we can use this to our advantage, and turn it into our biggest opportunity.Over the past 10 years, we’ve won 14 medals between us. When we get knocked down, we’ve gotten back up and come back stronger by inviting a positive mindset, greeting challenges with a smile, choosing to be present, and being prepared to adapt. We want to share these skills with as many people as possible to enhance their lives, and to ensure that we are all prepared for adversity, so that we can accept, process, and move forward. These skills are for everyone, from people who want a better life to corporations who want a more resilient workplace.
about_author: With 14 medals, including seven golds, between us, we’ve been at the top of our sport for a long time. We met at a competition in 2013 and have been together ever since. We both had successful careers as individuals, but together we motivate and support each other. We continue to push our minds and bodies to the limit so that we can continue to be the best in the world.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2015

Thank you very much for the valuable wisdom.", 'reply': {}}, {'time': 'August 2021', 'name': 'Hollie', 'comment': 'Scott hosted an event for a large group as part of a work event. \n\nThe event was professional yet still personal and an amazing talk to listen to. title: Daring to Dream
time_end: 90 mins · Hosted in English and Arabic
act_int: Life is an unpredictable thing, oftentimes presenting us with challenges that seem impossible to overcome. But if I’ve learned anything from my experience, it’s that despite how difficult the circumstances are, we all have incredible inner strength and are capable of inspiring acts of resilience.My name is Ibrahim Al-Hussein, and I’m a paralympic swimmer from Syria and an Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 hopeful. In this unique storytelling experience, I will discuss my life journey, the road I took to the Olympics, and how I remained hopeful throughout all the obstacles I faced in life. You’ll get to know more about my hometown, the circumstances under which I lost my leg, how I became a refugee, what it was like for me to start a new life in Greece, and most importantly, how my passion for swimming remained a North Star anchoring me to my childhood Olympic dreams. We will think about the power of positivity, how I turn every No to a Yes, and why it is important to always believe in yourself, and challenge the physical and mental boxes others try to put you in, when it comes to your own strength and potential. Join me as we think through the refugee experience, the power of sports in overcoming adversity, and the importance of challenging preconceived notions about refugees and athletes with disabilities.
about_author: My name is Ibrahim, a paralympic swimmer & basketball player from Syria, and recipient of the Whang Youn Dai Overcome Prize during the Paralympic Games in Rio. My dreams, my goals, and my ambitions were shattered when I lost my leg in Syria and suddenly became a refugee. However, I kept persevering. I did not have a home or anyone to help me, but I kept going and learned to think beyond physical disability. By doing so, it’s allowed me to achieve many things, both physically and mentally, that have helped define my 20-year journey. Now I live in a new country where, at first, I didn't speak the language, nor did I have my family with me. Despite all of my hardship, I've endured, and I want others to benefit from my experiences. With the strength of will and the desire to succeed, I’ve achieved my dreams. And you can too.
author_time: Paralympian · Refugee Paralympic Team · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Corporate Mindset Through Sport
act_int: This experience is great for corporate groups. I am Andrew, Paralympic and World Champion. As a child, I lost part of my leg to bone cancer and despite the odds, I was able to survive. Some people counted me out (sound familiar) and didn't believe I could ever swim to the top of the podium.  If you are a corporate group, there is so much sport can teach us about business so I can share my sport and business knowledge in the chat. Here is a hint, "it's all about having a positive mindset".  My talk is for you and your group so for anyone that books I offer a complimentary call ahead of time. I've found these calls to be super helpful. Above all your satisfaction is my #1 priority. So please join me let's get on the path to greatness. I can't wait to talk with you.Some housekeeping to add onIf you happen to be in Europe (or another part of the world that may not be inline with Toronto time) I am open to starting early to fit your timing (ie, 5am Toronto time for a 10am start in London or 11am in Spain for instance). Also if you have a larger group (above 60 ppl) and want to chat about a fee that is a little more reasonable,  I am open to that as well. It's all about you and your team and meeting your group at the starting blocks.
about_author: I am originally from a small town in Nova Scotia but now I call Toronto home. My motto is to be better today than I was yesterday and be better tomorrow than I am today. With that in mind, I joined a swim team and the rest of my Hall of Fame career is history. I became a World Champion, a Paralympic Champion, and a World Record Holder.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Canada · Host on Airbnb since 2021

title: Gain vision from Lex Gillette
act_int: Learn to gain a greater vision of success with me. We will do a couple very simple writing exercises, all without using your sight. You’re probably wondering, so we’re going to discuss how I train and compete as a totally blind athlete. Here’s a little secret: anything significant involves others, and it’s teamwork that has helped me compete successfully and win gold medals. I am training for the 2021 Tokyo Paralympics, and you will join me on a brief virtual tour around my training facility.We’ll have a brief chat about the power of perspective and how we can use this to guide our actions daily, because there's no need for sight when you have a vision.
about_author: I am a totally blind Paralympic medalist and world champion in the long jump. I am a four-time Paralympian, four-time world champion, and current world record holder in the long jump with a leap of 22 feet and 1 inch. My goal is to represent Team USA in my fifth Paralympic Games at the Tokyo 2021 Paralympics. I aim to bring back gold for the United States.I'm also an Athlete Mentor for Classroom Champions. I volunteer my time to teach social and emotional learning skills within Classroom Champions’ Curriculum, underscoring the value of dreams, grit, and perseverance through the power of mentorship.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2016

title: Life at the Games with Jacob Templeton
act_int: Ever wondered what it’s like to be a Paralympian? Join me for this unique online experience to learn about the Paralympic Games. I’ll share my experiences as a Paralympian, and specifically what it’s like to be there in the moment. I’ll walk you through the qualifying process and lead-up to the games, including the training camp, the athletes’ village, the excitement of stepping onto the blocks, and exploring the host-city atmosphere after the race. Being a Paralympian is something that’s absolutely changed my life, and I want to share how it’s truly achievable for any aspiring individual. Just bring your enthusiasm and any questions you’d like to ask me. I want you to leave with knowledge, an appreciation of the Paralympics, and an eagerness to reach your own goals and dreams.
about_author: I’m a Paralympian swimmer with a vision impairment. This comes with many challenges, but I live life to the full. I reached multiple finals in the 2016 Rio Games, and I aspire to stand on the podium in Tokyo in 2021. One of the most rewarding aspects of being an elite athlete is sharing my knowledge with people from all over the world, to help them realize their own potential.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2019

title: The Winning Mentality for 2022 with Olympic Silver Medalist
act_int: Hear from an Olympic silver medalist and Tokyo Games Olympian what it's like to compete in and win a silver medal in the Beijing Olympics. I'll share the "dream big, work hard, have faith" lessons I've learned in my journey to becoming an Olympic silver medalist, with the hope that I will inspire you to live your dreams and achieve your goals.
about_author: I’m an Olympic and Commonwealth Games silver medalist, a Pan-American Games gold medalist, and two-time NCAA Division I 400m champion. I’m a certified fitness instructor and sports nutrition coach, a nutritional supplements specialist, and a motivational speaker. I've obtained a bachelor’s degree in business management, a master’s degree in business administration, and started a PhD in education.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Bahamas · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Focusing at Eighty-Eight mph Headfirst
act_int: This Experience is great for team-building, book a private experience for your group! Is there a date and/or time that works best for your group that's not listed? Is your group larger than my listed max group size for private groups? Send me a message! :DWe'll go through some stories from my sport, and I’ll teach you the tips and tricks of how I stay focused and how you can apply this in your daily life. This will including some journaling, mindfulness and breathing exercise. This experience is especially kid and family friendly!The strategies in this Virtual Experience were inspired by Classroom Champions’ Social and Emotional Learning Foundations Curriculum. Classroom Champions pairs Olympians and Paralympians with underserved classrooms across North America to help kids understand the real-world application of skills like perseverance, goal setting, and leadership through this powerful mentorship.Match the value of your experience with a donation to Classroom Champions - www.classroomchampions.orgOther things to noteIf you’re able to, try to attend in a quieter, less busy space. Somewhere you can focus and concentrate on your needs will be best. Be ready to have some open discussions, or if you’re shy that’s ok too! Know that we’ll be in a safe space for you to share and be open.
about_author: I was born and raised in North Vancouver and was a multisport athlete. After graduating in the Spring of 2011, I moved to Whistler that fall, to pursue the sport of skeleton without ever having tried it. I told myself, this is what I'm going to do. Once I set my mind to something, there is no stopping me. I hurl myself headfirst down a giant ice slide on a glorified cookie sheet reaching speeds of up to 140km/h. My name is Jane Channell and I am a Canadian Olympic Skeleton Athlete.Did you know Jane is also an Athlete Mentor for Classroom Champions? She volunteers her time to teach social and emotional learning skills within Classroom Champions’ Curriculum, underscoring the value of dreams, grit, and perseverance through the power of mentorship.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Canada · Host on Airbnb since 2015

title: Reduce Stress & Boost Wellbeing with Qi Gong
act_int: The style of Calligraphy Health Qigong is a game changer if you're stressed out, have low energy, or have aches and pains in your body. I’ll show you how this incredible movement practice can help you return to a state of peace and harmony. The best part is that anyone can do it, no matter who you are, how old you are, or your physical ability. And it can be adjusted to suit your needs—in fact it helped me go from using a wheelchair to hiking in mountains. The Calligraphy Health System of Qigong is a modern twist on an ancient practice, combining elements of Tai Chi and Yoga, developed by Master Yang, who comes from a 400-year-old lineage. This Experience is great for boosting the energy of your group. I'm excited to share this with you.
about_author: I’m an Australian wheelchair tennis champion. I’ve competed in two Paralympics—London and Rio—and was ranked eighth in the world. At age 13, I began a three-year battle with cancer. The only way to save my life was to remove the right half of my pelvis. I was in a wheelchair for many years, but secretly always wondered if I’d be able to walk long distances again. Through Calligraphy Qigong, not only did I walk again, but I put my wheelchair away and went on to hike one of the hardest treks in the world: the Kokoda Track. In addition to giving me back my mobility, the practices healed the chronic pain I lived with for 15 years. There's nothing I love more than practicing on the beach.For the last 10 years I've been sharing my journey and the lessons I've learned with individuals, schools and businesses.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2014

title: Climbing Games & Mindset with Josh Levin
act_int: Join me on a journey to unlock the mindset of the world's top rock climbers while playing interactive climbing games along the way! Together, we’ll explore what it takes to climb at the highest level, all while learning to cultivate this mindset ourselves.Whether you’re new to climbing or you’re already an experienced climber, my goal with this experience is to help you unlock your creativity & gain the skills necessary to tackle your next challenge with confidence.In this class, we’ll primarily focus on active visualization (route reading) and how to apply it to climbing and beyond.First, we’ll analyze footage of the best climbers in the world across multiple disciplines and define active visualization. Next, we’ll warm up and practice the visualization techniques we just learned. Finally, I’ll share some of my most valuable mental training activities through virtual interactive games we'll play together.Throughout the class, we’ll open up the discussion to any questions you may have. Looking forward to sharing this experience with you soon!** No prior experience nor equipment required **Online rock climbing class. For corporate bookings, team-building events, birthday parties, or private events, please send a private message to book in advance.IG: @joshlevin94
about_author: Hey there! My name is Josh Levin. I'm a professional climber, American Ninja Warrior contestant, mechanical engineer, and current grad student at Harvard University. Climbing has been my passion for over 20 years now and I've been fortunate enough to travel the world through my climbing experiences. In my competitive career, I've won 19 National Championships, 5 Continental Championships, and the bronze medal at the Youth World Championships. I’ve also been involved as an advocate for climbing’s inclusion in the Olympic Games and have served as an ambassador to the IOC on several occasions. In my spare time, you can find me listening to podcasts or reading Calvin & Hobbes. Looking forward to meeting you soon!
author_time: Representing USA · Host on Airbnb since 2015

title: Private yoga & meditation with Olympian
act_int: This online experience kicks off with a Q & A where you can ask me anything you want about yoga, snowboarding, the Olympics, or anything in-between.I’ll then guide a vinyasa flow. I specialize in teaching a “strong slow flow” class where we will start off slow with an emphasis on breath, warming, and preparing the body. We’ll then gradually build to the peak with optional challenges along the way, including inversion(s). Meditation will follow cooldown. Just before signing off, I’ll guide you into your final relaxation where you can remain for as long as you desire in the comfort of your own home without any disturbances. These private or group classes are for all levels of yoga practitioners and will be tailored accordingly. Yin and/or meditation sessions are also available on request.This Experience is great for team-building and is available to be booked as a private experience for your group of up to 500 people.
about_author: I'm Olympic pro snowboarder and a YTT500hr qualified yoga teacher. Throughout my professional snowboarding career I have sought out ways to counteract the high demands and pressures that come with [life and] being a professional athlete; I give back to my physical body through yoga and soothe my mind through rest and relaxation practices. I specialise in teaching Vinyasa, Yin, Yin-Yang, and Meditation classes (both in person and online). These private sessions can either be booked as a one-on-one or as a private group bookings (up to 500 people).Yoga [and mediation] have had a huge impact on my physical and mental performance both in my personal and professional life. This practice helps me be the best athlete and best version of myself that I can be and I'm passionate about helping others develop these tools also :)
author_time: Olympian · Representing New Zealand · Host on Airbnb since 2014

title: Mind Mastery with Goldie Sayers
act_int: Join me, Olympic medal winner Goldie Sayers, as I share my journey in athletics and look at key high performance factors that are common in every area of life in order to be successful. I will focus on cultivating resilience, motivation and a consistently positive attitude, plus many of the lessons learnt during a 15-year career in professional sport that culminated in winning an Olympic medal.What you will learn:-        How to increase your confidence-        How to remain motivated -        How to cultivate resilience-        How to set, stay on track and achieve your goals-        How to set up your day in the best possible way to achieve your goalsOther things to note:This is an hour session. Note taking is advisable and there will be opportunity to ask questions. Be as interactive as you want to be. Just bring yourself, six post-it notes and a pen and paper. Do get in touch if you can't find the time slot you require or you want to book a group session. I can usually accommodate individual needs.
about_author: I competed for Great Britain in the javelin for over 15 years at three Olympic Games, five World Championships and three European Championships. I won Olympic bronze at the Beijing Olympics and was 11-time national champion, captaining the GB team on numerous occasions.Since retiring in 2016, I have been an executive coach at FTSE 100 companies developing confidence and improving performance.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2016

title: Training with an Olympic athlete
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in Portuguese, English, and Spanish
act_int: My experience involves muscle strengthening exercises with body weight. Functional exercises to work the whole body, together with a final chat, answering the participant's questions and curiosities. The activity lasts for 1 hour, and 15 minutes can be reserved exclusively for chatting or chatting can take place during class with the exercises.Other things to noteIt is necessary to inform the space you have and if you have accessories such as rubber bands, weight, chair, etc. available, so that I can include them in the class. It is also very important that guests speak if they have any limitations or something that is important for me to know.
about_author: I am an Olympic athlete (Rio 2016) of pole vault, and I have more than 25 years of experience in athletics. I have a degree in Biology in the United States and Physical Education in Brazil. Today I work as a personal trainer and I love what I do and I love to tell my athlete stories, especially the pole vault!
author_time: Olympian · Representing Brazil · Host on Airbnb since 2017

title: Behind the Scenes of Olympic Gold
act_int: Be inspired and captivated during this journey of purpose, courage, and determination as I give you a private look into the making of a champion. Feel your own perspective on life shift as you discover winners aren’t born, they’re made. My experience will teach you how to perform under pressure and leave you ready to hit your own targets with real skills and tools to take away. You’ll feel my energy, passion, and positive attitude towards life. I draw on the lessons learned from my extraordinary longevity and resilience during my sporting career to help you reframe your own challenges, goals, and perspective on life. I'm relatable, authentic, and down to earth. I’ll show you how to leave your comfort zone, taking you past your uncomfortable zone into the unknown zone where magic happens
about_author: I'm a three-time Olympian, winning both gold and bronze, and love to inspire with my passion for achieving success in any area of life. My published work includes practical tools to people from all walks of life, including Olympians on their journey to gold medals. I am also a professional motivational speaker, team-building facilitator, and mindset coach.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Personal performance and development coaching
act_int: Danny is a highly skilled and experienced coach in the world of personal development and performance.​In sport it is taken for granted the impact a good coach has on the success of an individual or team. They enhance the skills of their athlete through structured training plans and guiding them towards setting clear and focused goals, not just for the final outcome but each and every training session, holding the athlete accountable for their actions all the way. These skills are not reserved for elite sports people, anyone with a desire and passion to improve and grow their current situation has the potential to achieve more.​1-2-1 coaching sessions will allow you to:​Facilitate a change in attitude and behaviour to ensure you deliver the desired results.Develop your talent and potential.Improve your performance and effectiveness.Build confidence.Have a clear understanding of what you want to achieve and why through targeted questions that challenge and support you.Give you the confidence to step outside of your comfort zone.Increase resilienceImprove mental strength​Danny brings a wealth of experience to his coaching sessions, he has been coached and mentored throughout his personal, sporting and business career. As a qualified and highly sought-after coach himself Danny uses these experiences combined with traditional coaching techniques.
about_author: As a Paralympic Gold Medal winner and former World Record holder I understand and have seen first-hand the benefit of working with a coach and the power of effective goal setting. My athletics coach approached my sporting goals the same way that we approach our personal and business goals.  First you need to be clear on what you want to achieve, why it is important to you and then you can map the journey.  I can help you succeed in all areas of your life and will be there to support, guide and challenge you every step of the way.I have been coaching in the field of personal development and performance for over 4 years and run and own a successful coaching business called 1404 Performance.  We create and deliver bespoke high-performance programmes into business as well as delivering 1-2-1 coaching.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2021

title: Art of reinvention with Simidele Adeagbo
act_int: Reinvention is essential for personal growth and evolution, but it's not always easy to achieve—especially now. To help you navigate this process, I'll share the transformational blueprint from my 100-day journey to becoming both the first African woman and the first black woman to compete in the Olympic skeleton—a sport I had no prior experience in and one in which athletes hurl themselves headfirst on a sled down an icy hill at 80 miles an hour. In this interactive experience designed to invite courage and resilience, I'll teach you the valuable lessons I learned in those 100 days—a time when I had returned to competitive sport after a nearly ten-year retirement. Find a comfy spot in your house and I'll walk you through how I reignited my original dream of competing in track and field at the Summer Olympics. Then, we'll explore different ways of overcoming fears, defying naysayers, and shattering perceptions. Imagine your limitless possibilities with an Olympian as I confidently guide you through this experience and help you push your limits and find your inner strength.*This experience is great for team-building. Book a private experience for your group. Is your group larger than my listed max group size for private groups? Send me a message.Other things to noteYou’ll need an internet connection and the ability to stream audio and video to participate. A link and details on how to join will be included in your booking confirmation email.Up to 10 guests ages 4 and up can attend.
about_author: In 2018, I made Olympic history at the Winter Games, becoming the first African and Black woman to compete in Olympic skeleton. When I discovered that no African woman had ever competed in the Olympic skeleton, I saw an opportunity to take action.I'm currently training for the 2022 Olympic Games and I also inspire audiences around the world. I've appeared in leading media outlets such as CNN, NBC, ESPN, USA Today, Essence, Forbes, and Sports Illustrated and the New York Times has hailed me as “a role model for Africa and beyond.”Audiences have described my live experiences as being “captivating” and “highly actionable” with a "contagious energy and passion.” And now, I'm bringing my inspirational tips directly to your home with this Online Experience!@SimiSleighsPhotos copyright Getty Images
author_time: Olympian · Representing Nigeria · Host on Airbnb since 2017

title: The Power of Inclusion with Carly Tait
act_int: Learn about my "zero to hero" sporting journey, which took me from the couch and placed me on to the 100m starting line at the 2016 Rio Paralympics in the space of four years. Discover how I leveraged years of prejudice, a lack of self-esteem, and the people around me to fulfill a dream. We'll be exploring how the removal of systemic barriers and positive inclusion play a part in altering your self-belief, creating opportunities, improving goal setting, and building an engaged and responsive team or workplace. I will do this by sharing my story as someone who grew up surrounded by life-limiting narratives and bad habits. I’ll also deepen your understanding of prejudice and ableism while giving you the tools to execute your goals through the power of small margins.
about_author: I’m mostly a typical person, but with one significant difference. I was born with cerebral palsy and spent my younger years shunning the label of being disabled. I did all I could to remove the negative connotations that came with being different and ignored barriers surrounding everyday life. Instead I adapted, persevered, and developed the stamina to push through social inequalities. The London 2012 Paralympics media coverage was my first experience of positive representation. This act of inclusion rewired years of internalised prejudice and gave me the drive I needed to become a Paralympic athlete in just four years. Since retiring from athletics I have become a passionate advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion, and work as a disability consultant transforming workplace culture.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2021

title: Gold Medal HIIT with Kat Copeland
act_int: We'll ease ourselves in with some introductions. I'll share my experience of the Olympic Games, including some personal behind-the-scenes photos, and talk about what life is like as a full-time elite athlete. We'll then get moving. As a fully qualified personal trainer, I will take you through a warm-up, upper-body strength movements, and our main HIIT—High-Intensity Interval Training—workout. The HIIT workout is designed to be more interactive than your usual online program and I’ll be right there with you working hard. I'll include movements I do in my own program, developing both strength and cardio capacity, so you can get real insight into a rower’s training.This session is suitable for all levels and I’ll offer options for everything we do. Whether you're an avid gym goer or more comfortable on the couch, variations of each exercise will help bring out your best. To finish, I'll answer any questions you might have, from training and fitness to what it's like to sit on the starting line of an Olympic final or live in the Olympic Village.This experience is great for team-building. Book a private experience for your group. Is your group larger than my listed max group size for private groups or you'd like a different time slot? Send me a message.Other things to notePlease let me know in advance if you have any injuries I should be aware of so I can adapt the session if needed.
about_author: I'm Kate, an Olympic champion and two-time Olympian (London 2012 & Rio 2016).In addition to my Olympic achievements, I’m also a multiple World and European medallist, and have broken several world record times. Since retiring from rowing one year ago, I've been sharing my passion for sport through coaching and mentoring younger athletes, and have also worked with numerous businesses and universities, providing talks and insight on performance psychology and the lessons I've learned. I actually never used to be fit and I hated PE at school! Then I found rowing, and it took me down a path that I'd have never expected. In addition to being an Olympian, I’m also a personal trainer. I love creating classes that are fun, relaxed and energizing. My goal is that people come away from my experiences feeling better than when they came in.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2012

title: Motivation with Jacob Templeton
act_int: I’m an elite athlete who’s faced many challenges and at times heartbreak. In this online session I'll share my own experiences to help you overcome the struggles you go through on a daily basis and attack them with a positive perspective. All you need to bring with you is a great attitude and any questions you may have.I live with a vision impairment, which means I have a limited tunnel of vision. I’ve had to find ways to adapt and continue with the tasks ahead of me.With all of these experiences, I’ve learned a lot about motivation and perspective. I want to inspire and educate you about how you can overcome your own obstacles and move forward. Sometimes the easy way out is to quit, but I want to help you fight and continue on with your journey.
about_author: I’m a Paralympian swimmer with a vision impairment. This comes with many challenges, but I live life to the full. I reached multiple finals in the 2016 Rio Games, and I aspire to stand on the podium in Tokyo in 2021. One of the most rewarding aspects of being an elite athlete is sharing my knowledge with people from all over the world, to help them realize their own potential.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Australia · Host on Airbnb since 2019

title: Sync & stretch with Olympian Katie Clark
act_int: Find out first-hand what it takes to train like a Synchronised Swimmer! Long gone are the days of Esther Williams style float patterns and flowery hats. At an average of 40 hours per week, Synchronised Swimming is the 2nd most trained for Olympic Sport.We'll begin the session with some informal intros and I'll share my experiences of life as a full-time athlete, showing you what it's like to compete at two Olympic Games- including some behind-the-scenes photos of training and the Olympic villages! After that, we’ll get ready for a 60 minute exercise session where I will take you through a full body Synchro based workout- without even needing to get wet! The workout will consist of the following components: - 10 minutes Warm-up - 10 minutes Mobility work - 20 minutes Pilates/barre based work - 20 minutes Active stretching Finally we can have some time to do a Q&A where you can ask me anything at all about Synchronized Swimming, the Olympics, or maybe you can finally find out how long we really do hold our breath for! Get ready for a challenging but fun workout with a twist!Other things to noteThis experience is best viewed on a computer/laptop/tablet if possible. I'm very used to teaching and coaching people of all ability levels so I will make sure to provide variations of exercises for different levels or any injuries you may have.
about_author: Hey everyone! My name is Katie, and I'm a double Olympic athlete.My athlete journey began at the age of 7 when I started synchronised swimming. By the age of 15 I had joined the national team and was fortunate enough to go on to represent Great Britain at both the London 2012 and Rio 2016 Olympic Games. Since then, I’ve gone on to coach the next generation of athletes. With over 9 years of coaching experience, I’m passionate about encouraging people to stay healthy through exercise and instilling wellness into every aspect of daily life. My Education/Qualifications include:- BSc Applied Sports Science- APPI Level 3 Pilates Matwork- BARRE Mat Pilates- ASA Level 2 Synchronised SwimmingInstagram: @katieclark_23Website: www.katie-clark.com
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Dreams into Goals w/ Gold Medalist
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and French
act_int: Together we will start turning dreams into achievable goals so we can live our life to the fullest by creating a dreamboard. First I will start by introducing myself and how I turned my dreams into reality by putting my dreams on a dreamboard. I will give examples of how I have achieved my dream life. I will help you find the inner kid in you again by learning to dream again. Together we will start by turning past, current and maybe new dreams into accomplishable goals. We will share together our dreams  and create a dream board together. Who knows, maybe you will even find new dreams to pursue that you did not even know existed. Let's start dream building together.
about_author: One day I saw a video of Michael Jordan playing basketball when I was a kid. That was the day I knew deep inside I wanted to become a great basketball player. I kept dreaming and became obsessed with how to achieve that dream. Since then, I started competing in wheelchair basketball and became pretty darn good at it. I have became a 2x Gold medalist and World Champion. My leadership has given me the opportunity to represent my country as the flag-bearer at the 2016 Paralympics. I have also been  a multiple MVP award and athlete of the year recipient. Some say I am a legend of the game. The pursuit of my dream has made me travel the world and made me  friends all around the globe.  I have been captain for most of my career and helped hundreds others accomplish their own dreams. I am now blessed with a beautiful wife and 2 wonderful kids.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Canada · Host on Airbnb since 2021

We had time to ask questions and get his input.  He shared how he personally took his dreams, set them up as goals, and realized his goals from gold medals to having his photo on a huge marquee.  He shared visualization methods that help motivate him and keep him focused on his goals.  Great ideas and concepts.", 'reply': {}}, {'time': 'February 2022', 'name': 'Lisa', 'comment': "Loved hearing David's story and what you can achieve if you set goals no matter big or small they are. Always dream, never stop!!", 'reply': {}}, {'time': 'August 2021', 'name': 'Emily', 'comment': 'Thank you, David, for sharing your story.  We will work on our dream boards and make them a reality!', 'reply': {}}]

title: Cultivating an Olympian Mindset for Everyday Life
act_int: Great for groups as a team building activity to increase confidence, optimism, and motivation!Do you want to create an Olympian mindset for everyday life? How do you set big goals and achieve them? As a 3x Olympian, I’m often asked what it takes to win at the highest level. What do Olympic athletes have that the rest don’t? We have a mindset that is programmed to win. But we aren’t born with a winning mindset. It is developed. The great news is, anyone and everyone who wants to learn can acquire it. I want to share with you the keys to winning at the highest level in sports, career and life. I want to help you become unstoppable! I've shared my winning strategies with teams from AirBnb, AWS, Barclays, Entrepreneurs' Organization, Facebook, Google,  IBM, Liberty Mutual, MUFG Bank, Prudential, PwC, Salesforce, Uber, and Usana. I’m excited to share the same strategies through my Olympic journey with you too!In our live session, I will share incredible insight from my 25 year journey. Like what it really took to go from last place in my first cycling competition to the world number 1 in my event. I will tell you about my setbacks such as the time I spent 5 days in the hospital ICU fighting for my life to fight for an Olympic medal just 4 months later.  We will discuss the key mental traits required to break through huge barriers and how it can apply to your life.
about_author: I am a three-time Olympian. I flew the flag for Malaysia at Athens 2004, Beijing 2008, and London 2012.I help people to work towards achieving their goals. Through workshops and mentorship, I will help you build a pathway to pursue excellence in sports career and life.I took me pedalling over 28 million pedal strokes, and lifting over 1 million kilogram of weight over a 10 year period to go from last place in my first cycling competition to becoming the first Asian to make a keirin final in an Olympic Games.I co-founded and was the CEO of Australian hospitality tech start up, Intertain.com.au. I'm also a published author, TEDx speaker, and MotorGP Performance Coach.My mission is to inspire and teach others to dream big, set goals, and acquire the skill sets necessary to achieve their goals."Everyday is Game Day" is my motto.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Malaysia · Host on Airbnb since 2011

title: Track-star training with Anyika Onuora
act_int: Are you ready to train with an Olympian?I’ll take you through an exciting, virtual HIIT (high-intensity interval training) workout that includes a warmup, rest breaks, and a cool down. All workouts will range between low and high impact. Please specify if you are currently carrying any injuries or specific pain before we begin.After the workout, I’ll be sharing my journey in sport and what it took for me to achieve my dreams, including how I won my Olympic medal even after contracting Malaria ten months prior. We’ll wrap up the session with a Q&A and I’ll also show you the shiny medals I won.
about_author: I’m a Team GB track and field athlete who competed in the sprints events. I’ve competed in three Olympic Games and have won medals at the European Championships, Commonwealth Games, World Championships, and Olympic Games.I was born and bred in Liverpool, UK. Thanks to my sport, not only have I been blessed enough to travel the world, but also to share my journey with everyone.Away from the sport, I host my own podcast, "Hidden Greatness," in which I interview people from the world of sports to talk about the highs and lows of their profession and uncover the hidden greatness therein.I am also an ambassador for Malaria No More UK and help others through mentoring programs and motivational speaking.©Getty Images
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2015

title: Living the Paralympics with Benoit Huot
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in English and French
act_int: This experience is about “Living the Paralympics” together. I had the privilege of participating in 10 Paralympic Games from an athlete to a broadcaster for Team Canada. My objective is to share the history of the Paralympic Games, the evolution over the past 25 years, and my dream of seeing a common goal towards inclusion. I will make an emphasis on how an athlete prepares for the Games, before, during, and after. Before we start, I’ll send you an email asking what you'd like to get out of your session. I am flexible and open to ideas, so please do not hesitate to ask specific questions. I’m here to make this experience as engaging as possible. Come with an open mind in this session and get ready to learn and have fun!
about_author: You can call me Ben. I was born with a disability on my right leg known as clubfoot. I started swimming when I was eight years old. I had the privilege of participating as a swimmer in five Paralympic Games. Between those games, I brought home 20 Paralympic medals, plus nine golds. Since my retirement from competitive swimming, I have served as a sports broadcaster at the last three Winter Games.
author_time: Paralympian · Representing Canada · Host on Airbnb since 2015

title: Survive & thrive with Asif Sultani
act_int: With the help of personal pictures and stories, I will take you through the journey of my life, from fleeing my homeland due to persecution and war to arriving in Australia by boat and creating a life for myself. Throughout my life I have endured traumatic experiences that I was able to survive with a resilient mindset. I want to talk to you about these experiences and share how you too could practice and integrate resilience into your life. After surviving my journey as a refugee, I have since taught myself to thrive by letting go of all fear of failure and allowing my faith to be stronger than my fear. I want to share the power of this mindfulness with you.I want to hear about your life; your goals and challenges, and the things that you could achieve if fear did not hold you back. Towards the end of the session I will guide you through a brief meditation that has helped me perform both physically and mentally. The meditation will be centered around empowerment, to manifest your goals and leave you feeling inspired.This Experience is great for team-building. Book a private experience for your group. Is your group larger than my listed max group size for private groups? Send me a message.
about_author: For the past 3 years, I have been an IOC Refugee Scholarship holder for the Tokyo Olympics, where I had hope to compete in Karate. Originally from Afghanistan, I fled to Iran due to ongoing conflict and war when I was young. I stayed there until I was 16, during which time I was persecuted because of my ethnicity. Due to the need to protect myself, I began learning and developing a passion for Martial Arts. Around seven years ago, I fled to Australia as an asylum seeker by boat. I have since been granted Refugee status. With the recent announcement of the Refugee Olympic Team, sadly I was not selected. I am now focusing on sharing my story of survival and resilience, advocating for refugees, and inspiring people to be the best versions of themselves. I also work as a Personal Fitness Trainer and a Disability Support Worker.
author_time: Refugee Athletes · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Making the impossible possible
act_int: In this Experience, I share with guests lessons on how to keep chasing your dreams no matter what, and why moments of despair can actually represent opportunities for change and success. I’ll help you understand why, especially in those times, taking risks is so important. I want you to go for the thing that has a 1% chance of working out, not the thing that has a 99% chance of working out. Throughout our session, I’ll tell you my life story. I’ll give you first-hand examples of perseverance, and I’ll show you how I never stopped pursuing my dreams. I faced many challenges in my life, and at one point, was even told to give up on my career as a professional athlete when I was only 24, but I refused to listen, and I’m so glad I chose to keep fighting for my dreams instead, leaving everything I knew and found comfort in behind me as I did so.  I learned so much along the way, and it helped me get to where I am today: an Olympian on his way to the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games. I want to share those lessons with you and what my journey to the Games looked like, but I also want to hear firsthand about the dreams and hopes you have for yourself and the challenges you’re struggling with along the way so that we can talk about how you can overcome them!   So, Join me for this experience, and let us learn from each other!
about_author: Hi, I’m Shahrad and I’m originally from Iran (born and raised). Due to some circumstances I had to leave my country and went to the US. At first, it felt new, I struggled with feeling like I belonged and realized I had to fight harder than ever for the simplest things, like a place to train, to work, not to mention all the other needs and difficulties in my personal life.Despite these obstacles and the total absence of support, I was able to win first place in the US National Trials. Then, after only eight months of having been in the US, I was selected to join the Independent Paralympic Athletes Team at the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games in Rio. With no one to assist me, I ranked first place in the US National Trials.Today I am proud to compete in the Tokyo 2020 Games and I look forward to discovering just how far perseverance can take me
author_time: Paralympian · Refugee Paralympic Team · Host on Airbnb since 2020

title: Taekwondo champion full-body workout
time_end: 60 mins · Hosted in German and English
act_int: There’s nothing more I love than meeting new people and guiding them through a great workout!  Do you want to combine a fun, feel-good exercise, while also listening to an eye-opening story of perseverance that motivates you to never give up on your dreams? Then join me, a Taekwondo contender, as we mix several unique themes together in my physical health Online Experience! I’ll share with you my journey as a refugee athlete training for the Paris Olympics 2024 Games. As we learn about the unique experience of refugee athletes, we will warm up and then dive into a full-body workout for 30 minutes, after which we’ll stretch and cool off before we move on to learn more about Taekwondo as a martial art. I will show you a few simple and fun Taekwondo moves, at the end, and bust a few myths about some of the martial art moves you see in the movies—of which there are many, it turns out ;) Every fitness level is welcome! Know that I will adjust our exercises based on each person’s level of comfort, and we will find what works for you! Come join me, let’s work out and have some fun!
about_author: My Name is Ehsan and I am a professional Taekwondo athlete. I’ve been following my passion for my sport for over 20 years and It’s only getting stronger as time goes by. At the moment I’m preparing for several competitions and continue to be a Paris 2024 Olympic Games hopeful.Next to my Taekwondo training, I love full-body workouts and fitness. I enjoy sharing my knowledge and motivating other people! So, let's work out together!Next to German and English, I also speak Persian and Kurdish.
author_time: Refugee Athletes · Host on Airbnb since 2018

title: Olympian's Experience and Swimming and/or Leadership advice
act_int: This would be an interactive online talk.  It is flexible to suit the guests but the agenda is:1. Introduction - who I am and the schedule for this session. You can ask for alterations at this point if keen to do so? 2. As a 3 time Olympian I explain my personal experiences and describe the processes of training, selection, preparation and involvement within the Olympics.3.Advice on training generally using swimming (pool or open water) Triathlon or Modern Pentathlon/Tetrathlon as examples. This can also cover Military leadership/training and Industry leadership/training if requested.BREAK (15min). 4. Technical improvement in a skill based on swimming  (theory) as I have coached club/international swimmers.   5. Explain and inspire Leadership.  I have competed, led and volunteered at Olympic Games and other world events (e.g. Rugby World Cup, Formula 1 and Modern Pentathlon European champs). I have led in industry and am a senior field officer in the British Army so have a wide experience of professional leadership.  (depending on your wishes).6. Q&A.                              up to 2hr  approximately
about_author: Following 3 Olympics where Roland made finals in all and has a number of World, Commonwealth and European medals. His swimming career includes world records, world championship titles and over 35 years of international competing.  He has coached, run swim clinics, after dinner speaking, supported events as an Olympian or Swimmer/Modern Pentathlete star attraction, coached clubs/Army teams, presented prizes at events and is a member of various committees (GB Olympians committee, Much Wenlock Olympic Committee and swimming clubs).Added to this he is a manufacturing manager and British Army Officer who has extensive leadership and training experience in these two areas.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2018

Well recommended :)', 'reply': {}}, {'time': 'August 2021', 'name': 'Cristian', 'comment': 'He was awesome and very helpful, I learned a lot of things to improve my skills on swimming. Please don’t hesitate to share a time with him.', 'reply': {}}, {'time': 'June 2021', 'name': 'Tara', 'comment': 'My daughters gifted me this wonderful AirBnb experience for my birthday. As an introduction to myself – as an adult I learned how to swim  – and lap swimming has become a passion of mine.  I attended this event with my wife who swims as well.

 

In short, this event was terrific and Roland was wonderful. I most enjoyed collecting the ‘pearls of wisdom’ that Roland gave us – pearls that no doubt will provide us with a better approach to swimming and our training.  I felt privileged to have the opportunity to learn from such a highly accomplished swimmer.  Additionally, Roland was very receptive to questions and focused his comments on what we were interested in.  He provided a wonderful learning experience with great humor and humility – making this a relaxed and fun time.  (I have a new understanding of ‘warm-ups’ and ‘cool-downs’.) No doubt, given his background and coaching experience, Roland has much to offer swimmers of any level. Great event! Thank you!', 'reply': {}}, {'time': 'August 2021', 'name': 'Cas', 'comment': 'Fascinating two hours of discussion about the Olympics, work , swimming, leadership and management. Plenty of tips to take away!', 'reply': {}}]

title: Olympian poise with Tasha Danvers
act_int: Would you like to know what it's like standing face-to-face with your one chance to fulfill everything you've ever dreamed of accomplishing? That’s how it felt for me, standing at the start line of the 400m Hurdles Olympic Final, knowing that the next 60 seconds would determine the trajectory of the rest of my life. I’ll show you how to cultivate a champion’s mindset that will help you win in life.You’ll learn how Olympians maintain poise under the immense pressure of life-changing moments with finesse, by creating your own perspective and blocking out distractions. You’ll be able to apply these skills whether you're participating as part of a team-building activity, or simply taking part for your own personal experience.
about_author: I'm a two-time Olympian and Beijing Olympic Bronze medalist in the 400m Hurdles. This is often called “the man’s event”: not only do you have to be in a full sprint to the finish line (your goal), you also have to navigate hurdles (challenges), weather conditions (the unexpected), and sometimes hitting hurdles (setbacks), all while maintaining a winning mindset. My journey began in Sydney 2000, when I made the Olympic finals. In 2004, at the peak of my career as first in the UK and sixth in the world, I took on an even bigger calling to become a mother. When others had written me off, I went back and reclaimed my place on the podium in Beijing 2008 with my three-year-old son cheering me on. I bring my values of fun, humor, authenticity, growth, freedom, and triumph to every experience.
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2013

title: Finding Confidence with Hugh Hutchison
act_int: This is a motivational, interactive coaching session focusing on key qualities and attributes for self-confidence and success in today’s ever-changing and challenging world. The session is focused on you. I will use my personal experience and knowledge and translate it to your personal situation and we will create a plan to help take you where you want to go.We will discuss:Passion and beliefSelf-motivation and focusCommitment and determinationPlanning and setting targetsFlexibilityDealing with change and failureIndividual approach and the support teamI will share some of my Olympic skiing experiences, insights from my career as an officer in the British Army, and what I learned as a commercial executive for global corporations and international sports and event companies.Other things to noteIf you feel like you need some motivation and help from someone who has competed at World and Olympic level as well as having been successful in business then this session could help you achieve the next step in your journey.
about_author: I'm an Olympic freestyle skier. I've competed in the World Cup Mogul Tour for five years, as well as the Albertville and Lillehammer Winter Olympic Games. I won the British Senior Mogul title four times, as well as European and Commonwealth titles.I'm also a former officer in the Royal Engineers and a business executive for private and public companies around the world.Since retiring from competitive skiing, I have commentated and been a pundit for Olympic Broadcast Services, the BBC, Eurosport and Sky. I have worked in this capacity on several Winter Olympic Games including the 2018 games in Korea.Copyright Getty Images
author_time: Olympian · Representing Great Britain · Host on Airbnb since 2020
